modules.description: This module manages client-side communication over a shared memory ring, providing functions to write requests, push updates, and wait for responses asynchronously. It works with ring buffers and Lwt threads, handling synchronization and notification mechanics. Concrete use cases include coordinating data transfer between virtual machines and hypervisors, or implementing efficient inter-process communication with minimal latency.

Implements server-side handling of shared memory ring operations for asynchronous communication. Works with typed rings and buffers to manage request-response cycles. Used to initialize a server endpoint and push processed responses to clients over the ring.

This module provides client and server implementations for asynchronous communication over shared memory rings. It supports writing requests, pushing updates, and waiting for responses using Lwt threads, with typed rings and buffers for synchronization. Used for low-latency inter-process communication and coordination between virtual machines and hypervisors.
